column2: INDIANA DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
column4: Indiana
column6: IN

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column4: Prepare to stop
column6: Yield the right-of-way

column2: 2. This road sign means:
column4: Curve ahead
column6: Merge right

column2: 3. Blind spots are:
column4: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.
column6: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.
column10: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.

column2: 4. When moving across a railroad track, it is safe to stop on the track for a short period of time.
column4: False
column6: True

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column4: Keep right
column6: Divided highway begins

column2: 6. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a reduction of lanes.
column6: a bridge ahead, wide enough to accommodate two lanes of traffic, but with very little clearance.
column8: a dip in the road. Drivers should be ready to stop if the dip is filled with water.

column2: 7. Parking is not allowed:
column4: within 250 feet of a traffic light.
column6: in an intersection, unless permitted by signs.
column8: within 300 feet of a pedestrian safety area.

column2: 8. This sign warns ____________ ahead.
column4: of a reduction of lanes
column6: that a reversible lane starts.

column2: 9. Two motorcyclists are allowed to:
column4: ride side-by-side in a single lane.
column6: race on empty roads.
column8: exceed the posted speed limit when driving on expressways.
column10: share the lane with another vehicle.

column2: 10. Drivers who become stranded in blizzard conditions should remain in their vehicle.
column4: False
column6: True

column2: 11. Your red traffic signal changes to green while a pedestrian is crossing in your traffic lane. The right of way should be given:
column4: by the pedestrian, but only when vehicles are turning left.
column6: to you.

column2: 12. When following a motorcycle, drivers do not need to allow as much distance as when following a car.
column4: True
column6: False

column2: 13. This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
column4: minimum speed
column6: reaction speed

column2: 14. Driving under the influence of any medication which impairs your driving ability is permitted:
column4: if you dont feel drowsy.
column6: if it is prescribed by a physician.

column2: 15. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, if the road you enter has two lanes, you:
column4: must turn into its left lane.
column6: must go to the next intersection.
column8: must turn into its right lane.

column2: 16. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.
column6: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.
column8: be ready to stop at the stop sign.
column10: stop doing what they are doing.

column2: 17. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column4: To keep a smooth traffic flow.
column6: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.
column10: To decrease the state average speed statistic.

column2: 18. A driver cuts off another vehicle, or threatens another motorist or a pedestrian. These are examples of:
column4: defensive driving
column6: furious driving

column2: 19. This road sign means:
column4: Two-way traffic
column6: No left turn

column2: 20. Are bicyclists required to obey traffic laws and signs?
column4: No, bicyclists are considered pedestrians when it comes to the rules of the road.
column6: Yes, but only if they are riding in a bicycle lane.
column8: Not if they are licensed bicyclists.

column2: 21. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column10: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.

column2: 22. When on a two-lane roadway, drivers must stop when approaching a stopped school bus with its red warning lights flashing and stop arm extended.
column4: True
column6: False

column2: 23. What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
column4: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.
column6: Make eye contact.
column10: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.

column2: 24. If a driver follows you too closely, you should:
column4: increase your speed as you are probably driving too slowly.
column6: move to another lane if possible.

column2: 25. In heavy rain, tires can begin to ride on the water that is on top of the road pavement. This is called:
column4: waterplaning.
column6: rideplaning.

column2: 26. One broken line indicates:
column4: You can not pass other vehicles or go across the line.
column6: You can change lanes, but only when traffic conditions or obstructions in the road make it necessary.
column8: You can pass other vehicles and change lanes, if it is safe.

column2: 27. A merge sign means drivers should be prepared to change lanes or allow other traffic to come into their lane.
column4: True
column6: False

column2: 28. The shape of a route sign tells you:
column4: the speed limit on that route.
column6: the type of route you are on.
column8: that the route you are on might be dangerous.
column10: how many miles are left before you reach your destination.

column2: 29. When they see this sign, drivers:
column4: should not speed up or brake quickly.
column6: should be prepared to make sharp turns at a high speed.
column10: need to be prepared to turn right and then left quickly.

column2: 30. If your gas pedal is stuck, you should:
column4: turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.
column6: ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it. If not, shift into neutral and use the brake to slow your vehicle and get off the road.
column10: try pumping it to increase pressure.

column2: 31. If you are convicted of illegally passing a stopped school bus:
column4: you will be forced to attend a reckless driving course.
column6: your driving privileges or vehicle registration will be suspended, and you will face a large fine.

column2: 32. When an aggressive driver confronts you, you should:
column4: Try to move away safely.
column6: Remain calm and relaxed.
column8: Report aggressive drivers to law enforcement authorities.

column2: 33. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must not make a right turn.
column6: U-turns are not allowed.
column8: they must make a left turn at the intersection.

column2: 34. This road sign means:
column4: You have the right of way
column6: Slow down if an emergency vehicle is approaching

column2: 35. A flashing red light means:
column4: The light will soon change to steady red.
column6: The same as a STOP sign.
column10: Go, but yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.

column2: 36. This sign indicates that:
column4: the safe speed around the curve ahead is at least 25 MPH.
column6: there is a school zone after the curve.
column8: drivers may not turn right if traveling at 25 MPH or less.
column10: the highest safe speed drivers should travel around the curve ahead is 25 MPH.

column2: 37. Your BAC depends on:
column4: the amount of alcohol you drink.
column6: the type of beverage you drink.

column2: 38. An orange sign means drivers should be alert, adjust their speed and be prepared to stop if necessary.
column4: False
column6: True

column2: 39. This road sign means:
column4: Sharp turn to the left
column6: Low shoulder

column2: 40. Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
column4: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.
column6: Motorcycles are hard to see.
column8: It is  hard to judge how far away a motorcycle is.

column2: 41. While you are in an intersection waiting to make a left turn, the traffic signal light turns red. You should:
column4: wait in the intersection until the light turns green again.
column6: back up from the intersection after making sure it is clear.
column8: yield to oncoming traffic and complete the turn.

column2: 42. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.
column6: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.
column8: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.

column2: 43. If you are pulled over by law enforcement, you should stay in the driver’s seat with both hands clearly in sight on the steering wheel.
column4: False
column6: True

column2: 44. What should you do if your vision through the windshield becomes blocked?
column4: Pull your vehicle off the road and park it.
column6: Turn on your emergency lights.
column8: Open the side window so you can see.

column2: 45. In case of skidding, drivers should NOT:
column4: take their foot off the gas pedal.
column6: pump the brakes gently if they are about to hit something.
column8: steer the car into the direction of the skid.
column10: tap the gas pedal with their foot.

column2: 46. An edge line that angles toward the center of the road indicates that:
column4: there’s a narrow bridge ahead.
column6: you must turn right.

column2: 47. Left turns on a red light are allowed:
column4: in school zones.
column6: at intersections, after stopping, if the way is clear.
column8: from a one-way street into a one-way street.

column2: 48. This road sign:
column4: is a no-right-turns sign.
column6: warns drivers that U-turns are not permitted.
column8: warns drivers of a sharp turn left. Drivers should slow their speed and keep to the left.
column10: provides an advance notice of a roundabout.

column2: 49. You go with a group of friends to a social event, and you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
column4: avoid alternating between drinks with alcohol and drinks without any alcohol.
column6: stop drinking several minutes before you intend to leave.
column8: arrange to ride home with a friend who does not drink.
column10: make alcohol the focus of the event.

column2: 50. Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
column4: you cannot pass.
column6: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.
